channel.title: Port Foward Problem, PLEASE HELP
channel.description: lately ive been having troubles getting my server online, im port fowarded correctly, ive had people check, i have my firewall acceptions, everything is good, but i figured out that my ports aren't open. i have a netgear router. ive been trying to open them/get programs to open them, but its still no good. i go to canyouseeme.org and this other website (cant remember the name atm : p) but they both say my ports are closed and i just cant figure out how to fix this.. ive been searching for hours and me friends who are familer with port fowarding and servers are lost and cant figure it out either.. if someone can help me ill be very happy, thanks

item.title: Port Foward Problem, PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @Gravity_pk Gravity pk
item.description:
@Gravity_pk wrote:

ya i did everything, i even had 2 different friends who are really good with PF and servers check it out and said it was good, but it just doesn’t work… it doesn’t make sense. the only thing different from that guide is that it says to put your default gateway ip, but even though its the same router mine i had to put my actual ip. but it was still the same setup and everything, and everything worked good, and yes i have no-ip and everything set up right and everything, it just dont understand.

Read full topic

And where it says the Server Ip Address [10].[ ].[ ].[ ] you put in the IPV4 address from the command prompt?

item.title: Port Foward Problem, PLEASE HELP
item.dc:creator: @aquatizscape aquatizscape
item.description:
@aquatizscape wrote:

This happened to me when i first started out. If you Press
[CTRL] [ALT] [DEL] and open task manager, open up process tab.
You have a program that is running the port 43594, thus closing it off for your server. The most general one is uTorrent… If you have limewire utorrent itunes, anything close them all out then recheck the port.
hope i helped!

Read full topic
